loading the library ggplot2 for nice plot functions
```{r}
library(ggplot2)
```

loading our data from a csv file
```{r}
sort_data = read.csv("../results.csv")
summary(sort_data)
str(sort_data)

```

first ploting function, it is not very clear
```{r}

ggplot( data = sort_data, aes(x=Input_size, y=Execution_time, color=factor(Language))) + geom_point() + scale_x_log10() + scale_y_log10()
```

filtering by language, or size, or anything
```{r}
data_size106 = subset(sort_data, Input_size == 100000)
str(data_size106)
ggplot( data = data_size106, aes(x= Input_size, y = Execution_time, color=Language)) + geom_point()

data_size101 = subset(sort_data, Input_size == 10)
str(data_size101)
ggplot( data = data_size101, aes(x= Input_size, y = Execution_time, color=Language)) + geom_point()









data_cpp = subset(sort_data, Language == "CPP")


str(data_cpp)



```
